updated_cases.title: Validate the "END_HEADERS" Flag in Headers Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Configure H2 Server with MAX_FRAME_SIZE set to default(16384).
2. Make a H2 GET Request for Resource with Header Block length 32768.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should should split the connection into two connections. and maintain a connection b/w client <--> proxy and another b/w proxy <--> server using Http2.
2. the Proxy should use server's "MAX_FRAME_SIZE" setting for connection b/w proxy and client".
3. A field block that does not fit within a HEADERS frame is continued in a CONTINUATION frame.
4. When set, the END_HEADERS flag indicates that this frame is last and contains an entire field block and is not followed by any CONTINUATION frames.

updated_cases.title: Validate the "END_STREAM" Flag in Headers Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Configure H2 Server with MAX_FRAME_SIZE set to default(16384).
2. Make a H2 GET Request for Resource with Header Block length 32768.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should should split the connection into two connections. and maintain a connection b/w client <--> proxy and another b/w proxy <--> server using Http2.
2. the Proxy should use server's "MAX_FRAME_SIZE" setting for connection b/w proxy and client".
3. A field block that does not fit within a HEADERS frame is continued in a CONTINUATION frame.
4. A HEADERS frame with the END_STREAM flag set signals the end of a stream. However, a HEADERS frame with the END_STREAM flag set can be followed by CONTINUATION frames on the same stream. Logically, the CONTINUATION frames are part of the HEADERS frame.

updated_cases.title: Validate the 'Headers' Frame with Padding.
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Configure H2 Server with MAX_FRAME_SIZE set to default(16384).
2. Configure Client to send Header Field with Padding length 8.
3. Make a H2 GET Request for Resource with Header Block length 32768.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should should split the connection into two connections. and maintain a connection b/w client <--> proxy and another b/w proxy <--> server using Http2.
2. the Proxy should use server's "MAX_FRAME_SIZE" setting for connection b/w proxy and client.
3. A field block that does not fit within a HEADERS frame is continued in a CONTINUATION frame.
4. Padding is added to Header frames to obscure the size of messages. Padding is a security feature.
5. Proxy should able to parse the Headers Frame with Padding.

updated_cases.title: Validate the 'DATA' Frame with Default Settings
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Configure client and server with default setting.
2. Make H2 GET Request for Resource of size 10mb from server.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should should split the connection into two connections. and maintain a connection b/w client <--> proxy and another b/w proxy <--> server using Http2.
2. the Proxy should use client's "MAX_FRAME_SIZE" setting for connection b/w proxy and client as Frame length for DATA Frame.

updated_cases.title: Verify the 'END_STREAM' Flag in 'DATA' Frame.
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Configure client and server with default setting.
2. Make H2 GET Request for Resource of size 10mb from server.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should should split the connection into two connections. and maintain a connection b/w client <--> proxy and another b/w proxy <--> server using Http2.
2. the Proxy should use client's "MAX_FRAME_SIZE" setting for connection b/w proxy and client as Frame length for DATA Frame.
3. When 'END_STREAM' is set, it indicates that this frame is the last that the endpoint will send for the identified stream.

updated_cases.title: Verify the H2 "PING" Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Establish H2 Connection via nsproxy
2. From Client send PING Frame with 8 Octects of opaque data.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. PING Frames can be sent by either of parties.
2. Proxy should recognise the type of Frame and send to other party without any change.
3. if the client send the "PING" frame, server should receive it and MUST send a PING frame with the ACK flag set in response, with an identical frame payload. PING responses SHOULD be given higher priority than any other frame

updated_cases.title: Verify the "Continuation" Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary: Make a H2 Request via nsproxy with Header Block that is too large to fit in a single "Headers" Frame.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. H2 should send the additional Headers in "Continuation" Frame if the headers are too large to fit in a single HEADERS frame.
2. Proxy should recognise the type of Frame and send to other party without any change.
3. Server should receive the Frame.

updated_cases.title: Verify the "Priority" Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Establish a H2 Connection via nsproxy
2. From Client make sure, the "Priority" Frame is Sent for a Stream >0 to the server.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should recognise the type of Frame and send to other party without any change.
2. Server should receive it.
3. this frame notifies the server the priority/importance of a stream.

updated_cases.title: Verify the "RST_Stream" H2 Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary:
1. Establish a H2 Connetion from Client using custom tool/script(Python) via nsproxy
2. Using it send a "RST_Stream" for a Stream >0 Frame to server.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should recognise the type of Frame and send to other party without any change.
2. Using packet capture at Server and see if it receives the Frame.
3. Forcibly terminates a stream, this is only used if one endpoint decides to cancel a stream, it is not used for normal stream termination

updated_cases.title: Verify the "GOAWAY" H2 Frame
updated_cases.custom_summary: Make a H2 Request with Valid Setting and Close it.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. Proxy should recognise the GOAWAY Frame for closing the H2 Connection.
2. if the H2 transaction is valid, there shouldn't be any error code in the Frame.
3. GOAWAY allows an endpoint to gracefully stop accepting new streams while still finishing processing of previously established streams.
